title: geth not work as service with console command
body:
Yes, latest geth not work as service with console command.

my worked geth.service
```
[Unit]
Description=Geth Ethereum node
#Requires=network.target
After=syslog.target network.target

[Service]
User=root
Group=root
Type=simple
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/geth --datadir=/mnt/ethereum/eth --keystore=/mnt/ethereum/eth/keystore --syncmode=fast --cache=1024 --verbosity 3 --port 30303 --rpcapi=admin,db,eth,net,web3 --rpc --rpcaddr=0.0.0.0 --rpcport=8545 --rpccorsdomain=* >> /mnt/ethereum/geth.log 2>&1

Restart=on-failure
KillMode=process
KillSignal=SIGINT
TimeoutStopSec=90

[Install]
WantedBy=default.target
```
It is work fine, but all logs in system not in /mnt/ethereum/geth.log And if i add to ExecStart string "console" command like this:

`... console >> /mnt/ethereum/geth.log 2>&1`

I trying many variants, but no have lucky. How to get all logs in separated file, not in system logs? Thanks.

What logs are you missing?

You can't start the console as a background process. The console is an interactive shell and when you close the shell (input stream), it terminates itself.

I can't see any logs in my file /mnt/ethereum/geth.log only in /var/log/system.
How to put logs in any customs file ?

That's not really a go-ethereum issue. Our logs are output to stderr. If you run geth as a service via some serice runner framework, it's up to you to figure out how that particular framework handles logs.
